item.title: Hundreds leave Al-Shifa hospital as Israeli forces take control of facility
item.description: Patients, staff and displaced people left Gaza's largest hospital, health officials said, leaving behind only a skeleton crew to care for those too sick to move.

item.title: Biden repeats call for two-state solution in Middle East
item.description: In an op-ed published in the Washington Post Saturday, President Biden wrote that a "two-state solution is the only way to ensure the long-term security of both the Israeli and Palestinian people," with Gaza and the West Bank governed by the Palestinian Authority. Christina Ruffini reports from Washington.

item.title: Taylor Swift fan dies at Rio concert amid complaints about excessive heat
item.description: Swift posted in her Instagram stories after news of the fan's death writing she has "a shattered heart."

item.title: Hundreds of Palestinians flee Al-Shifa hospital
item.description: Hundreds of Palestinians have fled Gaza's largest hospital after Israeli forces seized it earlier this week, accusing Hamas of running a command center beneath it. Israel continues carry out deadly bombings across the besieged territory, while Israelis have taken to the streets demanding their government do more to free the hostages being held by Hamas. Imtiaz Tyab reports from Jerusalem.

item.title: Hundreds evacuate Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza
item.description: Hundreds of people have evacuated Al-Shifa Hospital, the largest hospital in Gaza. But the Hamas-run Gaza Health Ministry says more than 100 patients, including premature babies, are still unable to leave. CBS News' Imtiaz Tyab reports.

item.title: Inside the Smithsonian's tropical forest lab
item.description: The Smithsonian is one of the best-known museums in the United States, and an affiliated lab is a hidden gem. Located in Panama, the Tropical Research Institute is a unique scientific outpost located in one of the busiest waterways in the world. CBS News' Ben Tracy reports.

item.title: CBS News taken inside Al-Shifa hospital with Israeli military
item.description: Israel's military on Friday took journalists inside Al-Shifa hospital, Gaza's largest, after it was raided by Israeli soldiers this week. They showed reporters a tunnel entrance and weapons, which they said was evidence that Hamas was using the hospital as a command center. Imtiaz Tyab has more.

item.title: Israel says second hostage found dead near Gaza's Al-Shifa Hospital
item.description: "The national task before our eyes is to locate the missing and return the abducted persons home," the IDF said in a statement Friday.

item.title: Tanzania confirms intern believed taken by Hamas in Israel is dead
item.description: Clemence Felix Mtenga was working in Israel during the Oct. 7 attacks, one of 260 Tanzanians studying agriculture as part of an agreement between the Israeli and Tanzanian governments.

item.title: Potential volcanic eruption leaves Iceland town in limbo
item.description: The Icelandic fishing town of Grindavik has been evacuated as earthquakes are breaking open streets and "completely damaged" some homes: "There is no one living here. From 3,800 to zero."

item.title: "Significant" hoard of Bronze Age treasure unearthed in Wales
item.description: The items include a hoard of bronze artifacts such as axes, spearheads, rings and a sword scabbard.

item.title: Boat crammed with Rohingya refugees sent back to sea in Indonesia
item.description: About 250 Rohingya refugees crammed onto a wooden boat were turned away by locals off the coast of Aceh province.

item.title: U.N. says it's unable to deliver aid to Gaza due to lack of fuel
item.description: Gaza residents are facing the "immediate possibility of starvation," the World Health Organization says.

item.title: Mexican news photographer found shot to death in his car near U.S. border
item.description: The body of Ismael Villagómez was found in the driver's seat of a car in Ciudad Juarez, a violence-plagued city across the border from El Paso, Texas.

item.title: Iran's top diplomat says Hamas, other groups "make their own decisions"
item.description: Iran says it doesn't want the Israel-Hamas war to expand, but it has long backed Hamas - and other groups that are targeting U.S. forces in the region. Iran's Foreign Minister Hossein Amir-Abdollahian tells CBS News' Holly Williams that it's the U.S. "intensifying the war," and that Iran's allies make "their own decisions."

item.title: Arrest made over ecstasy-spiked champagne that killed restaurant patron
item.description: After drinking the tainted champagne, some of the customers were writhing in pain on the restaurant floor and screaming in agony, local media reported.

item.title: Blinken says U.S. and China have "consequential relationship"
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken told CBS News that China represents "one of the most consequential relationships" the U.S. has with any nation.

item.title: Israel shows cache of weapons at embattled Gaza hospital
item.description: Israel said the weapons and other items at Al-Shifa hospital were evidence of Hamas militants using Gaza's largest health facility for military purposes.

item.title: Israeli military continues search of Al-Shifa hospital
item.description: Israeli soldiers continued their search of Gaza's largest hospital Thursday, where they said they found more proof Hamas was using it as a command center, including a tunnel shaft and a vehicle with weapons. The body of 65-year-old Yehudit Weiss, one of the hostages abducted by Hamas militants on Oct. 7, was found in a building near Al-Shifa. Debora Patta reports from Israel.

item.title: Palestinians say Israeli settlers are seizing West Bank homes by force
item.description: Israelis in West Bank settlements considered illegal under international law are seizing Palestinian homes by force, residents tell CBS News.

item.title: Netanyahu says "strong indications" Hamas hostages were held in Gaza hospital
item.description: "If they were [there], they were taken out," Netanyahu told CBS News.

item.title: Blinken calls U.S.-China a "consequential relationship"
item.description: One day after President Biden met with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Northern California, Secretary of State Antony Blinken told "CBS News Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell in an interview Wednesday that China represents "one of the most consequential relationships" the U.S. has with any nation. He also addressed President Biden's remarks in which Mr. Biden again referred to Xi as a "dictator."

item.title: Netanyahu on a potential cease-fire, Al-Shifa hospital raid
item.description: In an interview with "CBS News Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell Wednesday, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Israel would consider a "temporary cease-fire" only if Hamas frees hostages. Netanyahu also said Israel has "concrete evidence" Hamas was using Al-Shifa hospital as a military command center.

item.title: Hostage's body recovered in building near Al-Shifa hospital, IDF says
item.description: Yehudit Weiss was abducted by Hamas from kibbutz Be'eri during the Oct. 7 attack on Israel.

item.title: Netanyahu says Israel had "strong indications" about where Hamas' hostages were held in Gaza
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told CBS News there were "strong indications" Hamas' hostages were being held at Gaza's Al-Shifa Hospital and that's "one of the main reasons" for the Israeli military's recent ground operation at the facility. Watch more from the interview Thursday on "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."

item.title: "Staggering" rise in global measles outbreaks in 2022, CDC and WHO report
item.description: Measles outbreaks worldwide climbed 68% from 2021.

item.title: China could send more pandas to the U.S., Xi Jinping suggests
item.description: "Panda diplomacy" between China and the U.S. appears to back on track.

item.title: Mark Esper: Defeating Hamas means dealing with Iran "once and for all"
item.description: Former U.S. Secretary of Defense Mark Esper said Israel should "absolutely" finish its fight against Hamas and root out the Palestinian militant group, but that doing so requires dealing with Iran​ "once and for all."

item.title: Is the right to free speech being curbed in Israel amid the war with Hamas?
item.description: "We arrived at October 7th already in a bad place when it comes to freedom of expression," an Israeli human rights lawyer says.

item.title: Russian artist gets 7 years in prison for antiwar protest at supermarket
item.description: Sasha Skochilenko is the latest Russian citizen to be affected by the country's crackdown on free speech.
